item.title: All NASA News - NASA
item.description: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

item.title: NASA News
item.description: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

item.title: NASA Astronaut Jonny Kim, Crewmates Return from Space Station - NASA
item.description: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim returned to Earth on Tuesday alongside Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky, wrapping up an eight-month science

item.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: Station Trio Back on Earth; Expedition 74 Keeps Up Science, Maintains Systems - NASA
item.description: Expedition 73 has ended and NASA astronaut Jonny Kim has returned to Houston and Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky have returned to Moscow. Expedition 74 is now underway with veteran NASA astronaut Mike Fincke as commander.

item.title: Soyuz Crew Lands Ending Eight-Month Space Research Journey - NASA
item.description: At 12:03 a.m. EST (10:03 a.m. local time), the Soyuz MS-27 spacecraft made a parachute-assisted landing on the steppe of Kazakhstan, southeast of the town of Dzhezkazgan.

item.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
item.description: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

item.title: New NASA Sensor Goes Hunting for Critical Minerals
item.description: Called AVIRIS-5, it’s the latest in a long line of sensors pioneered by NASA JPL to survey Earth, the Moon, and other worlds.

item.title: Invention Challenge Brings Student Engineers to NASA JPL
item.description: Now in its 26th year, the event brings teams of middle and high school students to the lab to compete with home-built contraptions.

item.title: NASA Selects 2 Instruments for Artemis IV Lunar Surface Science
item.description: The JPL-led South Pole Seismic Station will enable scientists to characterize the lunar interior structure to better understand geologic processes that affect planetary bodies.

item.title: NASA Completes Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope Construction
item.description: Set to launch by May 2027, the spacecraft will study mysteries of the cosmos while also testing the Coronagraph Instrument, a new technology designed and built by JPL.

item.title: NASA Rover Detects Electric Sparks in Mars Dust Devils, Storms
item.description: Perseverance confirmed a long-suspected phenomenon in which electrical discharges and their associated shock waves can be born within Red Planet mini-twisters.

item.title: NASA Tests Drones in Death Valley, Preps for Martian Sands and Skies
item.description: Next-generation drone flight software is just one of 25 technologies for the Red Planet that the space agency funded for development this year.

item.title: NASA Orbiter Shines New Light on Long-Running Martian Mystery
item.description: Results from an enhanced radar technique have demonstrated improvement to subsurface observations of Mars.

item.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
item.description: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

item.title: News
item.description: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, the leading center for robotic exploration of the solar system.

item.title: November 2025 Company Update
item.description: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. item.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
item.description: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

item.title: October 2025 Company Update
item.description: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. item.title: September 2025 Company Update
item.description: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch.
